UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that may represent a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Cholesterol-conjugated stapled peptides inhibit Ebola and Marburg viruses in vitro and in vivo.
Literature.Author: Pessi A, Bixler SL, Soloveva V, et al.

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human embryonic kidney HEK293T cells:50% Cytotoxicity=>=25 µM
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Ebola virus EBOV(IC50 I=3.89±0.61µM),Ebola virus EBOV(IC90 I=16.86µM),Marburg virus MARV(IC50 I=11.54±1.50µM),Marburg virus MARV(IC90 I=31.38µM),Sudan virus SUDV(IC50 I=1.67±0.22µM),Sudan virus SUDV(IC90 I=6.87µM),Chikungunya virus (CHIKV)(IC50 I=>100µM),Human cervical carcinoma HeLa(50-60% Cytotoxicity=>30µM),Human osteosarcoma U2OS(50-60% Cytotoxicity=>30µM),Ebola virus EBOV-GP PsV(IC50 E=2.45±1.09µM),Ebola virus EBOV-GP PsV(IC90=29.46µM),Marburg virus MARV-GP PsV(IC50 E=6.20±1.38µM),Marburg virus MARV-GP PsV(IC90=25.58µM)
